section.title: Why Validate Your Document
section.para: The LDP uses a number of scripts to distribute your document. These scripts submit your document to the CVS (like a content management system), and then transform your document to other formats that users then read. Your document will also be mirrored on a number of sites worldwide (yet another set of scripts).

In order for these scripts to work correctly, your document must be both well formed (grammatically correct) using valid markup (spell checked). Well formed means your document follows the (grammar) rules that XML is expecting. Valid markup means you only use elements or tags (spelling) which are valid for your document. The spelling (valid markup) depends on which DOCTYPE is used for your document.
If your document is not well formed, and valid, the scripts will not be able to process your document. As a result, your document will not be distributed.

tip.para: There is more information about how to validate your document in the DocBook section. Check out for more help with validating your document.
